name: 3-MeO-PCMo
summary: A less common dissociative anaesthetic compound related to PCP. An analogue of 3-meo-pcp, but far less potent. Possibly an antitussive and antidepressant. Very little history of human use or pharmacological information.
addictionPotential: moderately addictive with a high potential for abuse

tolerance.full: develops with prolonged and repeated use

effects: Auditory hallucination, Auditory distortion, Geometry, Pattern recognition suppression, Double vision, Perspective distortion, Cognitive disconnection, Physical disconnection, Nausea, Spontaneous bodily sensations, Physical autonomy, Physical euphoria, Dream potentiation, Time distortion, Déjà vu, Conceptual thinking, Cognitive euphoria, Visual disconnection, Thought deceleration, Memory suppression, Disinhibition, Tactile suppression, Perception of bodily lightness, Motor control loss, Anxiety suppression, Increased music appreciation, Existential self-realization, Creativity enhancement, Depersonalization, Compulsive redosing, Derealization, Amnesia, Visual acuity suppression, Spatial disorientation, Mania, Immersion intensification, Auditory acuity suppression, Visual processing deceleration, Analysis depression, Increased introspection
